etymologies: Old English, from medieval Latin crisma, ecclesiastical Latin chrisma, from Greek khrisma ‘anointing’, from khriein ‘anoint’

definitions: a mixture of oil and balsam, consecrated and used for anointing at baptism and in other rites of Catholic, Orthodox, and Anglican Churches.
shortDefinitions: mixture of oil and balsam, consecrated and used for anointing at baptism and in other rites of Catholic
